intro: Trymalium flabellare, commonly known as the broad-leaved trymalium, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforest or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
